Name: ASN.1
Human-readable?: Yes (BER, DER, PER, OER, or custom via ECN)
Supports references?e: Yes (XER, JER, GSER, or custom via ECN)

Name: Common Data Representation (CDR)
Standard APIs: ADA, C, C++, Java, Cobol, Lisp, Python, Ruby, Smalltalk

Name: Fast Binary Encoding
Standard APIs: C++, C#, Go, Java, JavaScript, Kotlin, Python, Ruby

Name: FlatBuffers
Standard APIs: C++, Java, C#, Go, Python, Rust, JavaScript, PHP, C, Dart, Lua, TypeScript

Name: FHIR[2]
Standard APIs: Hapi for FHIR[3] JSON, XML, Turtle

Name: HOCON
Standard APIs: Yes (native Java API for all JVM languages)

Name: JSON
Binary?: No, but see BSON, Smile, UBJSON
Schema-IDL?: alternately: JSONPath, JPath, JSPON,[dead link] json:select()), JSON-LD
Standard APIs: Partial (JSON Schema Proposal, ASN.1 with JER, Kwalify, Rx, Itemscript Schema), JSON-LD

Name: Protocol Buffers (protobuf)
Standard APIs: C++, C#, Java, Python, Javascript, Go

Name: SCaViS
Standard APIs: Yes (Native Java API, bindings for Jython, JRuby, Groovy and others)

Name: Smile
Schema-IDL?: Partial (JSON Schema Proposal, other JSON schemas/IDLs)
Standard APIs: Partial (via JSON APIs implemented with Smile backend, on Jackson, Python)

Name: SOAP
Binary?: Partial (Efficient XML Interchange, Binary XML, Fast Infoset, MTOM, XSD base64 data)

Name: transit
Standard APIs: Yes Clojure, Java, Python, Javascript, Ruby, Scala

Name: XML
Binary?: Partial (Efficient XML Interchange, Binary XML, Fast Infoset, XSD base64 data)

Name: YAML
Creator-maintainer: Clark Evans, Ingy döt Net, and Oren Ben-Kiki
Based on: C, Java, Perl, Python, Ruby, Email, HTML, MIME, URI, XML, SAX, SOAP, JSON[5]
